text: 35 students passed the AP Chemistry exam. 11 scored a 5. I printed out the results and put them on the fridge.
Paid off the car. Twelve years of payments, done. Venkat and I went out for dosas to celebrate.
Called my sister in Chennai. Three hours on the phone. The time difference makes it hard but we always find the time.
Rohan sent me a job listing he's applying for. It's not in his field but it's good work. I told him I was proud. I meant it.
Spent Saturday morning at the library researching Japan itineraries. Printed 14 pages. Some things are better on paper.
Called my sister in Chennai. Three hours on the phone. The time difference makes it hard but we always find the time.
I realize I still think of myself as the young teacher. Then I look at photos from 2001 and remember how much time has passed. It's not sad exactly.
Used the AI chatbot to help draft a letter to the district about curriculum materials. It was surprisingly good. I only changed a few words.
Spent Saturday morning at the library researching Japan itineraries. Printed 14 pages. Some things are better on paper.
Made filter coffee and corrected 32 lab reports before 7am. I do my best thinking before the house wakes up.
Booked the Portugal trip — Lisbon and the Algarve. September. I've wanted to go for ten years. We finally did it.
Booked the Portugal trip — Lisbon and the Algarve. September. I've wanted to go for ten years. We finally did it.
Spent Saturday morning at the library researching Japan itineraries. Printed 14 pages. Some things are better on paper.
Parent-teacher conferences. Fourteen families in three hours. My feet hurt but two parents teared up thanking me. That's why.
Tried ChatGPT again today for a lesson plan on electronegativity. It was actually helpful. I still typed very slowly and second-guessed everything I wrote.

Rohan sent me a job listing he's applying for. It's not in his field but it's good work. I told him I was proud. I meant it.
Cooked Sunday meal prep for the week. Sambar, rice, two kinds of curry. Venkat said the kitchen smelled like his mother's house. High praise.
Tried ChatGPT again today for a lesson plan on electronegativity. It was actually helpful. I still typed very slowly and second-guessed everything I wrote.

Walked the neighborhood after dinner. Knee held up. Forty minutes. Small victory.

Venkat and I looked at our retirement account statements tonight. We're behind where we expected to be. We didn't say much after. Just put on the TV.

Knee was bad today. Took the elevator for the first time all year. It felt like admitting something.
A student asked me today if AI could teach chemistry. I said it could help people learn but it can't wonder. That's still ours.
